newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russian government criticises U.S. again over Iraq.
newsitem.headline: Russian government criticises U.S. again over Iraq.

text.p: The Russian government called on the United States to stop using force in Iraq and accused Washington of placing itself above the United Nations Security Council.
"Military actions inside and around Iraq must be stopped," said a government statement carried by Interfax news agency.
"Russia calls urgently on all sides to renounce the logic of force and follow the path of political settlement."
It was the second Russian government criticism of U.S. raids on Iraq in two days.

"It (the raid) arouses serious concern that Washington is claiming the role of supreme arbiter, attempting to replace the Security Council, which in accordance with U.N. regulations, has the exclusive right to sanction the use of force," it added.
The government criticised Washington on Tuesday after the first of two waves of cruise missile strikes on southern Iraq in retaliation for attacks on the Kurdish north.
Moscow has generally taken a softer stance than the West on Iraq since the end of the 1991 Gulf War.
